markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Twin Parry](/Feats.aspx?ID=377) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Fighter" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=71" />
<trait label="Ranger" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=136" />
<trait label="Swashbuckler" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=321" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 90 <sup>2.0</sup>, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 147 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Dual-Weapon Warrior](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=57) (Level 6)

**Requirements**
You are wielding two melee weapons, one in each hand.

</column>

---

You use your two weapons to parry attacks. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, or a +2 circumstance bonus if either weapon has the [parry](/Traits.aspx?ID=190) trait. You lose this circumstance bonus if you no longer meet this feat's requirement.

<title level="2">Twin Parry leads to...</title>
[Twinned Defense (Fighter)](/Feats.aspx?ID=425), [Twinned Defense (Swashbuckler)](/Feats.aspx?ID=1553)
name: Twin Parry
requirement: You are wielding two melee weapons, one in each hand.
requirement_markdown: You are wielding two melee weapons, one in each hand.
